page.title: 05LLANGURIG, ECOLOGY.
page.content: For a fairly exposed area Llangurig is rich in wildlife. Birds: many large birds including buzzards, kestrels, ravens and some red kites. Also a few curlews and plovers. Many species of small birds including goldcrests, pied flycatches, and warblers. Animals: lots of hares foxes and badgers. Plenty of rabbits, grey squirrels and hegehogs. Pine martens and polecats seen in forestry. The river: no great quantity of fish due to pollution of some sort, possibly lead. Breeding salmon numbers down. Trees: a fair cross-section of deciduous trees but few oak trees of any size. Footpaths: not enough for walkers to enjoy the countrtyside. 35 trees planted by school children 1979.
